cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north toward Florida Big Bend, then forecast to turn northeast and track near or along the Georgia and South Carolina coasts before exiting into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the St. Mary's River, GA northward to Edisto Beach, SC (hurricane); Mouth of the St. Mary's River to South Santee River, SC (storm surge)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet, FL northward to Surf City, NC (tropical-storm warning along Atlantic coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, then the entire Georgia and South Carolina coasts, extending into North Carolina
weather_observation.34kt_max: 57% onset probability in the 06–18Z Wed (21-h) window, 85% cumulative
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely; brief hurricane-force gusts possible if the core clips the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation above ground possible along the Georgia coast, including the Savannah River entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause flash and urban flooding in the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered tornadoes, dangerous seas and rip currents, and possible channel shoaling from surge and runoff.
